newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Construction firm Poh Lian seeks Singapore listing.
newsitem.headline: Construction firm Poh Lian seeks Singapore listing.

text.p: Construction company Poh Lian Holdings said Tuesday it was seeking to list on the mainboard of the Stock Exchange of Singapore.
An official from United Overseas Bank, which is lead managing the offer, said: "They will list depending on exchange approval. They have not ben approved yet."
He declined to give further details.
Poh Lian supplies equipment such as metal scaffolding and platforms used in construction and maintenance work in property, shiprepair and petrochemicals.
A Business Times report on Tuesday said proceeds from the share offer would go to expanding its new business of supplying building materials like sand, cement, ironmongery and sanitary equipment.
Its other business is in property construction where it is currently involved in a Singapore $100 million contract to build seven blocks of public housing flats.
The group posted a turnover of over S$182 million and pre tax profit of S$8.7 million in 1996, said the report.
